remarks: If an element of a well-founded set satisfies a property ` ph ` , then there is a minimal element that satisfies ` ph ` .  (Contributed by Jeff Madsen, 18-Jun-2010.)  (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 18-Nov-2016.)
statement:
frminex.1 $e |- A e. _V $.
frminex.2 $e |- ( x = y -> ( ph <-> ps ) ) $.
frminex $p |- ( R Fr A -> ( E. x e. A ph -> E. x e. A ( ph /\ A. y e. A ( ps -> -. y R x ) ) ) ) $.
$d A x y $.
$d R x y $.
$d ph y $.
$d ps x $.
